channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ecuador rejects U.S. military bases in major defeat for President Noboa
item.description: Ecuadorians have decisively rejected a series of referendum measures, including plans for U.S. military bases and constitutional changes, handing Pres...

item.title: Why some ant colonies get tricked into killing their own queens
item.description: For some would-be ant queens, the easiest way to take over a colony is to dupe its worker ants into committing regicide.

item.title: Bangladesh's ousted prime minister sentenced to death for role in protest crackdown
item.description: A tribunal in Dhaka sentenced Sheikh Hasina to death for her involvement in the use of deadly force against protesters last year. She fled to India an...

item.title: FEMA acting chief David Richardson departs after 6 months on the job, officials say
item.description: The acting chief of the Federal Emergency Management Agency has left his post, marking another disruption in a year of staff and policy changes. His l...

item.title: Trump changes stance on Epstein files. And, the U.S. increases pressure on Venezuela
item.description: President Trump changes stance on the Epstein files, urging Republicans to support a House vote tomorrow. And, the U.S. military buildup in the Caribb...

item.title: Indiana Homeowner Charged in Shooting of Cleaning Woman Who Arrived at Wrong House
item.description: A man was charged with manslaughter after a woman was shot through the front door of a home before dawn this month in suburban Indianapolis.

item.title: Judge Says Justice Dept. May Have Committed Misconduct in Comey Case
item.description: The magistrate judge raised the question of whether “government misconduct” in the case might require dismissing the charges against the former F.B.I....

item.title: Why Britain Is Embracing ‘Negative Nation Branding’
item.description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer, trying to get a grip on a feverish immigration debate, is introducing a hard-line, contentious policy on refugees.

item.title: David Richardson, Acting FEMA Administration, Resigns
item.description: David Richardson had been on the job for six months. FEMA employees had questioned his ability to lead the agency.

item.title: 2 Charged in Over 300 Thefts at Mausoleums in Toronto Area
item.description: The thefts took place during the daytime when the pair would enter mausoleums to swipe necklaces and other jewelry from remains, the authorities said.

item.title: Former Bangladesh Prime Minister Is Sentenced to Death

item.title: Trump and the ‘Donroe Doctrine’
item.description: The president is claiming a special U.S. sphere of influence in the Western Hemisphere.

item.title: Here’s What Trump Should Actually Do for Fertility
item.description: Trump’s policies on in vitro fertilization are underwhelming but his announcement still made me optimistic.

item.title: 25 Girls Abducted From School in Nigeria
